alert.note: Alert for Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 9:34AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Warren, Rock Island, eastern Mercer, southwestern Whiteside, Henry and southeastern Scott Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 934 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Andalusia to near Viola to near Galesburg. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Milan, New Windsor, Alpha, Sherrard, Oak Grove and Cable around 940 AM CDT. Rock Island and Lynn Center around 945 AM CDT. Moline, Bettendorf, East Moline, Silvis, Colona, Coal Valley, Orion, Andover and Warner around 950 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cambridge, Hampton, Rapids City, Cleveland, Osborn, Port Byron, Geneseo, Galva, Atkinson, Kewanee and Erie. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa near mile marker 5. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 32. Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 21. Interstate 280 between mile markers 10 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren; Whiteside
